instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGGD? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD When you see ALL_SYS_PWRGGD, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  No Power
threads.message:
hi guys this time i have this board with no power, some corrosion around ISL and <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> area, after clean the pcb and replace isl i got green/orange light on charger but no fan spin

some measures

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.60v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>. 3.4V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>          5V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>.     3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>.    5V


with thermal cam i see <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> and <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> a little hot

any suggestion?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  No Power
threads.message:
If you get 5V at L7520, there should be voltage on other coils too; check them all.

<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is high?
Inspect <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> for corrosion.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  No Power
threads.message:
no corrosion, <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> replaced, measures

L7130.   8.59V
L7520.    5.1V
L7560.    3.3V
L7430.    0.11V
L7630.     1.05V
L7310.      0V
L7320.      0V

<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGGD</SIGNAL>    0.6V

what about <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> and <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> a little hot with thermal cam

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  No Power
threads.message:
"L7430.    0.11V"
Check diode mode to ground first.
If good, post <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> voltages; pins 6, 12, 16, 17.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  No Power
threads.message:
Diode mode on L7430 = 0.165

<CHIP>U7400</CHIP>
pin 6.  0.07V
pin 12.  5v
pin 16.  3v
pin 17. 0.35v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  No Power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  No Power
threads.message: already replaced two times, same result

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  No Power
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground at pin 6.
Also check all traces and surrounding components.
Just in case, replace R/<CAPACITOR>C7425</CAPACITOR>.
